canonical_explanation.text: Transport means moving people and things from one place to another. There are three main types of transport: road transport (car, bus, bicycle, auto-rickshaw, truck, train), water transport (boat, ship, ferry), and air transport (aeroplane, helicopter). We must follow road safety rules like stopping at a red light, walking on the zebra crossing, and looking both ways before crossing the road. Communication means sharing messages and information. We communicate using phones, letters, emails, newspapers, radio, and television. Long ago, people used bullock carts, horse carriages, and pigeon post, but now we have faster ways to travel and communicate.
rules: Road transport includes cars, buses, bicycles, auto-rickshaws, trucks, and trains.
Water transport includes boats, ships, and ferries.
Air transport includes aeroplanes and helicopters.
Traffic lights: Red means stop, Yellow means wait, Green means go.
We should use the zebra crossing and look both ways before crossing the road.
Communication means sharing messages using phones, letters, emails, radio, and TV.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a road transport?
questions.explanation_correct: A bus is a road transport. It travels on roads and carries many people from one place to another.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An aeroplane and helicopter fly in the air, and a ship sails on water. A bus runs on roads, making it road transport.

questions.question_text: What does a red traffic light mean?
questions.explanation_correct: A red traffic light means stop. All vehicles must stop when the light is red and wait for it to turn green before going.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red does not mean go, drive fast, or honk. Red always means stop. We must wait until the light turns green.

questions.question_text: Which of these travels on water?
questions.explanation_correct: A boat travels on water. Boats are used to cross rivers, lakes, and seas. They are a type of water transport.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cars, buses, and trains travel on roads or tracks. A boat is the one that travels on water.

questions.question_text: Which of these is used to talk to someone far away?
questions.explanation_correct: A phone is used to talk to someone far away. With a phone, we can call and speak to our friends and family anywhere in the world.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bicycle, bus, and train are types of transport, not communication. A phone is the means of communication that lets us talk to people far away.

questions.question_text: Which of these flies in the sky?
questions.explanation_correct: An aeroplane flies in the sky. It is the fastest way to travel long distances and is a type of air transport.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ships sail on water, trains run on tracks, and cars drive on roads. An aeroplane is the vehicle that flies in the sky.

questions.question_text: What does a green traffic light mean?
questions.explanation_correct: A green traffic light means go. When the light turns green, vehicles can move forward safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red means stop, yellow means wait, and there is no turn back signal. Green means go, and vehicles can start moving.

questions.question_text: We cross the road at the ___.
questions.explanation_correct: We should cross the road at the zebra crossing. The zebra crossing has white stripes on the road where vehicles must stop for people to cross safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Crossing in the middle of the road, behind a bus, or anywhere is dangerous. The zebra crossing is the safe place to cross the road.

questions.question_text: A letter is a means of ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A letter is a means of communication. We write letters to share news, feelings, and messages with people who are far away.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A letter is not for transport, cooking, or cleaning. It is a written message that we send to communicate with someone.

questions.question_text: A train runs on ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A train runs on railway tracks. The tracks are made of iron rails, and the train follows them from one station to another.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trains do not run on roads, water, or in the air. They run on special railway tracks made of iron rails.

questions.question_text: Which of these is an old way of travelling?
questions.explanation_correct: A bullock cart is an old way of travelling. Long ago, people used bullock carts pulled by oxen to travel and carry goods.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Aeroplanes, metro trains, and helicopters are modern vehicles. The bullock cart is an old traditional way of travelling in India.

questions.question_text: We get news from all over the world through ___.
questions.explanation_correct: We get news from all over the world through newspapers and television. These are means of communication that share information with many people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bicycle, bus, and boat are types of transport. Newspapers and television are communication tools that bring us news.

questions.question_text: An auto-rickshaw is a type of ___ transport.
questions.explanation_correct: An auto-rickshaw is a type of road transport. It is a three-wheeled vehicle commonly seen on Indian roads carrying passengers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Auto-rickshaws do not fly in the air, sail on water, or run on railway tracks. They travel on roads, so they are road transport.

questions.question_text: What does a yellow traffic light mean?
questions.explanation_correct: A yellow traffic light means get ready and wait. It is a signal that the light is about to change, so we should slow down and be ready.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Yellow does not mean go fast, stop completely, or turn left. It means slow down and wait because the light will change soon.

questions.question_text: Long ago, people sent messages using ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Long ago, people sent messages using pigeons. Trained pigeons would carry small notes tied to their legs and fly to deliver the message.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Email, mobile phones, and television are modern inventions. In olden days, trained pigeons were used to carry messages.

questions.question_text: Which vehicle carries the most passengers on roads?
questions.explanation_correct: A bus carries the most passengers on roads. A big bus can carry 40 to 60 people at a time, much more than other road vehicles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bicycle carries 1-2 people, a scooter carries 1-2, and an auto-rickshaw carries 3-4. A bus can carry many more passengers.

questions.question_text: Before crossing the road, we should ___.

options.text: Look left, then right, then left again

questions.explanation_correct: Before crossing the road, we should look left, then right, then left again. This helps us see if any vehicle is coming so we can cross safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Running, closing eyes, or talking on the phone while crossing is very dangerous. Always look both ways carefully before crossing.

questions.question_text: Riya wants to go from Delhi to Mumbai very quickly. Which transport should she use?
questions.explanation_correct: Riya should take an aeroplane to go from Delhi to Mumbai quickly. Aeroplanes are the fastest way to travel long distances.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bicycle and bullock cart are too slow for such a long journey. A boat cannot travel between Delhi and Mumbai. An aeroplane is the fastest option.

questions.question_text: Arjun is riding his bicycle. He should wear a ___ to be safe.
questions.explanation_correct: Arjun should wear a helmet while riding his bicycle. A helmet protects our head if we fall, keeping us safe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cap, hat, or scarf will not protect the head in a fall. A helmet is the right safety gear for cycling.

questions.question_text: Neha wants to send a birthday wish to her cousin right now. What is the fastest way?
questions.explanation_correct: Making a phone call is the fastest way to send a birthday wish right now. The phone connects us to people instantly, no matter how far they are.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A letter takes days, pigeons and drums are old methods. A phone call lets Neha talk to her cousin immediately.

questions.question_text: To cross a river, we need ___.
questions.explanation_correct: To cross a river, we need a boat. Boats float on water and can carry people and things across rivers, lakes, and seas.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A car, bicycle, and bus cannot travel on water. A boat is the right transport for crossing a river.

questions.question_text: Why should we wear a seat belt in a car?

options.text: To keep us safe in case the car stops suddenly

questions.explanation_correct: We wear a seat belt to keep us safe. If the car stops suddenly or has an accident, the seat belt holds us in place and prevents injury.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Seat belts are not about looks or comfort. They are a very important safety measure that protects us during sudden stops or accidents.

questions.question_text: How has communication changed from the past to now?

options.text: It has become faster and easier
It has not changed at all

questions.explanation_correct: Communication has become faster and easier. In the past, a letter took many days. Now, a phone call or email reaches instantly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Communication has definitely changed. It has not stayed the same or become slower. Modern phones and emails are much faster than old methods like pigeons and letters.

questions.question_text: Which vehicle does NOT need fuel (petrol or diesel) to run?
questions.explanation_correct: A bicycle does not need fuel to run. We pedal it with our legs, which is good exercise and does not cause any pollution.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cars, buses, and trucks need petrol or diesel to run. A bicycle runs on pedal power from our own legs, so it needs no fuel.

questions.question_text: Grandpa tells Arun that when he was young, he used to travel by horse carriage. Now Arun travels by car. What does this show?

options.text: Horse carriages are better than cars
Transport has become faster and more comfortable over time
Cars are worse than horse carriages

questions.explanation_correct: This shows that transport has become faster and more comfortable over time. Cars are much faster than horse carriages and can travel longer distances.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Transport has improved a lot. Cars are faster, more comfortable, and can go farther than horse carriages. Things have definitely changed for the better.

questions.question_text: A child is walking on the road and not on the footpath. This is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Walking on the road instead of the footpath is dangerous. Cars and other vehicles drive on the road, and we can get hurt. We should always walk on the footpath.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Walking on the road is not safe, not a good habit, and not fun. It is dangerous because vehicles can hit us. Always walk on the footpath.

questions.question_text: An email is like a ___ but much faster.
questions.explanation_correct: An email is like a letter but much faster. Both are written messages, but a letter takes days by post, while an email reaches in seconds through the internet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cars, boats, and bicycles are transport, not communication. An email is a modern, faster version of a traditional letter.

questions.question_text: Which of these vehicles causes NO air pollution?
questions.explanation_correct: A bicycle causes no air pollution because it does not use any fuel. It runs on pedal power and is the most environment-friendly vehicle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trucks, buses, and auto-rickshaws burn fuel and release smoke into the air. A bicycle runs without fuel and does not pollute the air.

questions.question_text: Which group has ONLY road transport?
questions.explanation_correct: Bus, bicycle, and auto-rickshaw are all road transport. They all travel on roads. Aeroplanes and helicopters are air transport, and boats, ships, and ferries are water transport.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Aeroplane and helicopter are air transport. Boat, ship, and ferry are water transport. Only bus, bicycle, and auto-rickshaw are all road transport.

questions.question_text: Match the correct order of traffic lights from top to bottom:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order of traffic lights from top to bottom is Red, Yellow, Green. Red is on top, yellow in the middle, and green at the bottom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The standard order is always Red on top, Yellow in the middle, and Green at the bottom. This is the same all over India.

questions.question_text: Which is the fastest way to travel a very long distance?
questions.explanation_correct: An aeroplane is the fastest way to travel a very long distance. It can fly at hundreds of kilometres per hour and reach far places in just a few hours.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Walking, bullock carts, and bicycles are very slow for long distances. The aeroplane is by far the fastest mode of transport.

questions.question_text: Which pair shows one old and one new way of communication?
questions.explanation_correct: Pigeon post is an old way and email is a new way of communication. Long ago, trained pigeons carried messages. Now we use email to send messages instantly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cars, buses, trains, aeroplanes, boats, and ships are all transport, not communication. Pigeon post (old) and email (new) are both forms of communication.

questions.question_text: Why do we have traffic rules?

options.text: To keep everyone on the road safe

questions.explanation_correct: We have traffic rules to keep everyone on the road safe. Rules like following traffic lights, using zebra crossings, and wearing seat belts prevent accidents.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Traffic rules are not for fun, slowing traffic, or selling cars. They exist to protect drivers, passengers, and people walking on the road.

questions.question_text: Which of these is both a means of transport and runs on tracks?
questions.explanation_correct: A train is a means of transport that runs on railway tracks. It can carry hundreds of people and goods over long distances.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Buses, bicycles, and auto-rickshaws all run on roads, not tracks. The train is the vehicle that runs on railway tracks.

questions.question_text: Radio is a means of ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Radio is a means of communication. Through the radio, we can listen to news, songs, stories, and important announcements.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Radio is not transport, cooking, or building. It is a communication tool that sends sounds like news and music to people everywhere.

questions.question_text: How is a helicopter different from an aeroplane?

options.text: A helicopter can go up and down in one spot, an aeroplane cannot

questions.explanation_correct: A helicopter can go straight up and down and stay in one spot in the air. An aeroplane needs a long runway to take off and land.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Helicopters do not run on water, and they are not exactly the same as aeroplanes. The key difference is that helicopters can hover in one place.

questions.question_text: Anu sees the traffic light is red but no cars are coming. Should she cross?

options.text: Yes, because no cars are coming
No, she should wait for the green signal

questions.explanation_correct: No, Anu should wait for the green signal. Even if no cars seem to be coming, a vehicle might appear suddenly. We must always follow traffic rules.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red means stop, always. Even if no cars are visible, a vehicle could come any time. Anu must wait for the green light to cross safely.

questions.question_text: People living on an island need ___ transport to reach the mainland.
questions.explanation_correct: People on an island need water transport (boat, ship) or air transport (aeroplane, helicopter) to reach the mainland, since there are no roads across the sea.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Roads and trains cannot cross the sea to an island. Water transport (boats, ships) or air transport (aeroplanes) are needed to travel to and from islands.

questions.question_text: Which statement about transport is TRUE?

options.text: Different types of transport move on different surfaces

questions.explanation_correct: Different types of transport move on different surfaces. Road vehicles use roads, water vehicles float on water, and air vehicles fly in the sky.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Boats do not fly, aeroplanes do not sail, and not all transport uses roads. Each type of transport uses its own surface - road, water, or air.

questions.question_text: Television is a means of communication because it ___.

options.text: Carries people from place to place
Shows us news, stories, and information

questions.explanation_correct: Television is a means of communication because it shows us news, stories, and information from all around the world. It helps us learn and stay informed.
questions.explanation_incorrect: TV does not carry people, cook food, or play with us. It communicates information, news, and entertainment to people watching it.

questions.question_text: Which is better for the environment: riding a bicycle or driving a car?
questions.explanation_correct: Riding a bicycle is better for the environment. A bicycle does not use fuel and does not produce smoke or pollution. It also keeps us healthy!
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cars burn fuel and produce smoke that pollutes the air. A bicycle uses no fuel and causes zero pollution, making it much better for the environment.

questions.question_text: An aeroplane is a type of air transport.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, an aeroplane is a type of air transport. It flies in the sky and is the fastest way to travel long distances.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. An aeroplane flies through the air, making it air transport. It carries passengers and cargo across long distances quickly.

questions.question_text: Red traffic light means go.
questions.explanation_correct: Red traffic light does not mean go. Red means stop! All vehicles and people must stop and wait when the light is red.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. Red always means stop. Green means go. Mixing them up can be very dangerous on the road.

questions.question_text: A phone is a means of communication.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, a phone is a means of communication. We use it to call and talk to people, send messages, and share information.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. A phone helps us communicate with people far away by making calls and sending messages.

questions.question_text: A boat travels on roads.
questions.explanation_correct: A boat does not travel on roads. A boat travels on water, like rivers, lakes, and seas. It is a type of water transport.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. Boats are made to float on water. Cars, buses, and trucks travel on roads, but boats travel on water.

questions.question_text: We should always walk on the footpath, not on the road.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we should always walk on the footpath. The road is for vehicles, and walking on it is dangerous. The footpath keeps us safe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. The footpath is the safe place for people to walk. Walking on the road where vehicles move is very dangerous.

questions.question_text: In the olden days, people used bullock carts to travel.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, in the olden days, people used bullock carts to travel. Bullocks (oxen) pulled the cart, which was a slow but common way of travelling.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Before cars and buses were invented, bullock carts were one of the main ways people in India travelled and carried goods.

questions.question_text: An email is faster than a letter sent by post.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, an email is much faster than a letter sent by post. An email reaches in seconds, but a posted letter can take several days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Email is a modern way of sending messages that reaches almost instantly, while posted letters take days to arrive.

questions.question_text: A helicopter can take off without a runway.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, a helicopter can take off without a runway. It can go straight up from a small area because of its spinning blades on top.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Unlike an aeroplane that needs a long runway, a helicopter can take off and land in a small open space by going straight up and down.

questions.question_text: Wearing a seat belt in a car is not important.
questions.explanation_correct: This is not true. Wearing a seat belt is very important. It keeps us safe by holding us in place if the car stops suddenly or has an accident.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. Seat belts save lives. Everyone in a car must wear a seat belt for safety. It is also a law in India.

questions.question_text: A newspaper is a means of communication that gives us daily news.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, a newspaper is a means of communication. It is printed every day and gives us news about what is happening in our city, country, and the world.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Newspapers are printed daily and deliver important news, stories, and information to people. They are an important communication tool.
